notes.observation: Maintenance tickets from the same hour exist, but CCTV shows him in Treasury hall. Which record was altered?
Forensic timestamps on the USB logs are newer than the actual transfer. Someone planted them later.
CCTV feed shows him in the lobby. Badge system indicates Treasury access. Two truths cannot coexist.
At 12:13 AM, CFO terminal requested OTP. Same second, Treasury system used OTP from ‘unknown device’. Split stream?
Digital signature valid, but IP trace points to internal test server instead of Rizvi’s workstation.
12:15 AM corrupted commit tagged to Abbilash, but originating machine ID matches another engineer’s server.

hints.pattern: When evidence contradicts itself, one of the records has been tampered with.
hints.reminder: Cross-check logs across different files. Single-source truths are unreliable.
